case.summary: Police officer charged with assault on protestor -- Protestor refused to leave area of City Hall after several requests -- Protestor taken to ground and handcuffed -- Protestor claimed he had pain in ribs and a shoulder abrasion -- HELD: Officer found not guilty -- Officer had legal right to arrest protestor under s. 119(2) of the Provincial Offences Procedure Act and s. 31 of the Criminal Code -- Force used in arrest was not excessive and was proportionate to that necessary to contain protestor and remove him from premises -- Any injuries sustained by protestor were the result of resisting arrest.
